The story, the characters - that's what you'll remember for year and years after you put it down. This game is more action oriented than I would have liked, but there's enough variety in combat styles to keep you entertained as you jump from nuance to nuance in this stellar story. If you haven't bought this already, you probably want to. do it.

BSI isn't a bad game but it falls short of the original Bioshock. The graphics are nice and stylized. There are a lot of varied settings, but the game has been streamlined to the point it misses greatness. While I appreciate shooters with wide open spaces, it is rather hard to do well from a combat mechanic perspective. You can only carry two weapons and rather little ammo. The weapons are not very interesting either. Some only serve to be replaced by other weapons. Scrounging for ammo and heath is rather stupid as you can't carry med kits and the ammo is very limited so you always have either have full ammo or no ammo. This is the opposite of what Bioshock did. The AI is either a critique of religious zealots or just bad. To make up for the bad AI enemies sometimes just have 10 times the HP of other enemies. Plasmids have been marginalized and are not used for puzzles. Instead you can ride a kind of roller coaster or open portals. Both of these aren't very interesting from a gameplay perspective. The boss fights aren't interesting but then again they never really were in the series. While I am criticizing it I will also add that you can’t save the game manually and you just get resurrected when you die. There are certainly plot twists but they are much more cutscene related. It may sound like I hate the game, but I don't. It could have been much more though. It has great atmosphere, excellent acting, and the first side kick character I don't find annoying. It also solves the original’s lack of NPCs that are trying to not kill you or not behind a glass wall. It is a much less lonely game that the original.

 I am not sure how critics can give the game an A with the combat faults (I played on hard until the last level where there didn’t seem to be enough ammo so I switched to normal)

Anyway I paid about 10 dollars for the game and I got my money's worth. 

Grade: B

Bioshock Infinite Review

(Story)
There's always a chance to make things right.  Bioshock Infinite is set in the early 20th century, just before World War I.  Rather than a city under the sea, the game takes place in Colombia, a city the floats in the sky.  You play as Booker, a Pinkerton agent  who finds himself in debt to his superiors.  He is given a chance at redemption and sent to Colombia where he must rescue Elizabeth, a girl born with special abilities and subsequently idolized there.  Naturally, people do not take kindly to Booker's presence and thus the main conflict is created.  As the story unfolds, you discover the origins of the city, learn about people who inhabit it, and discover it's wonders.  The plot can be a bit confusing at times so it's important to pay attention.  I had to play through the game three times before I understood everything, or at least believed I understood everything.

(Gameplay)
Again, Bioshock presents itself as a first person shooter.  This time around however, long range combat is just as relevant as close quarters combat.  You can only carry two weapons at a time.  Weapons can still be upgraded, but the upgrade no longer changes the appearance of the gun.  There are only eight vigors (plasmids) for you to use this time around in the base game.  You can equip two vigors at a time, switching between one or the other with a hot key.  Vigors can be upgraded for efficacy and also charged up for a secondary fire functionality in combat.  Combat is not as deep as Bioshock 1 or 2, but it is certainly not boring and can get intense at times.  Collectible clothing gives you passive abilities and the tonic system provides you with a rechargeable shield.  Health does not recharge, nor do your "salts", the new Adam.  There is not as much to do in between fights.  Hacking is gone (though I guess it fits with the time period) and there is little exploration to do.  You are presented with choices again since this is Bioshock. 

(Design)
The detail of this game is incredible.  It might be the best looking game I have that runs the Unreal 3 Engine.  The sounds and sights are something to behold.  Each environment feels different though the music is not as emotional.  There were no overlapping sound issues this time around too.

(Final Comments)
This game left an impression on me, and there are not many games I say that about.  While I consider it a departure from the series, I still highly recommend it based on its design and plot.  Your first 30-40 minutes are some of the most memorable you may ever have in a game.  The ending ties up the plot nicely and will get you thinking as well.  Catch some coins and make the pilgrimmage to Colombia if you can handle the truth.
Amazing. The games ending is deep and the whole game has all sorts of creepy. Totally worth pickuping up now it's on sale.
An excellent story that compliments its predecessors wonderfully. Its easily my favorite of the series and one of my favorite video game story lines to date.

The setup of the game well-rounded overall. It has a complex plot, nice graphics, and a good control layout. There are alot of unique twists and components in the game that really make it stand out from many others, and the "scientific explanation" behind the floating city is a real brain teaser

If you enjoyed Bioshock 1, Bioshock 3 will not be a disappointment but be ready for more story, and less shooter.  Bioshock Infinite is one of those gems that makes you feel like you're in a movie.  The last thirty minutes in particular are so deep, I had to browse the internet afterwards to make sure I really understood what had just happened in this parallel universe tale that is reminiscent of a film like Donnie Darko.   Many of the mechanics of Bioshock 1 are back including Infinite's own version of plasmids.  I was a little disappointed in the shooting.   I actually restarted the game at the highest difficulty level after realizing I hadn't even died once almost halfway through on the normal difficulty level.  It does get tougher in the second half though.   Probably my favorite new gameplay mechanic is the rail system where you can attach your magnetic arm to the aerial monorail system in the new world of Columbia and control your speeds, jump on enemies, achieve powerup perks that make this system of combat better, and more.  It also has a surprise twist tie-in to Bioshock 1's story.  Overall, an easy game, but a story better than most movies.  Not much replay value because of no mulitplayer although like the first Bioshock, I can see myself installing it years later for one more playthrough just to experience this wierd world one more time.
Que du bonheur. Jeu incontournable! <3

Bioshock Infinite... como comenzar? 

Es sin ningun tipo de duda el mejor juego que he jugado, porque?

Graficamente es hermoso

Jugablemente es perfecto

y la historia.... LA HISTORIA, es increible.

La ambientacion es super colorida a diferencia de los anteriores que son mas oscuros, La historia es completa y bastante complicada de entender y su banda sonora es muy hermosa.

Para entender este juego bien yo recomiendo jugarlo 2 veces

Cuando juegues este juego por primera vez, si es que se lo puede llamar juego, (porque yo lo considero una obra de arte). intenta mirar los detalles, porque esos pequeños detalles (narrativa visual, voxafonos, las conversaciones de los personajes) son la diferencia entre un buen juego y una obra de arte. cuando escuches una frase o una charla que carezca de sentido guardala en tu mente porque luego la entenderas. 

Cuando juegues por segunda vez comenzaras a ver poco a poco todo aquello que parecia irrelevante o que no tenia sentido comienza a encajar, comenzaras a darte cuenta de todo y tendras esa sensacion que tienes al ver que algo conecta con otro  "algo" ,esa sensacion que te deja duro y sorprendido, esa sensacion en este juego la tienes todo el tiempo. 

La mejor manera de disfrutar la historia completa es jugando Bioshock 1, Bioshock Infinite, Bioshock Infinite burial at sea 1, Bioshock Infinite burial at sea 2. en ese orden y con el mismo metodo... MIRA LOS DETALLES. 

Sin nada mas que agregar te digo que lo juegues porque no te vas a arrepentir y muy probablemente dile hola a tu nuevo videojuego favorito.

Bioshock Infinite puts its main focus on it's story rather than combat mechanics. And that's refreshing. 

Bioshock Infinite is an art masterpiece locked in the violent world of first-person shooters. It revolves around the satirical setting of 1900s America, with elements such as racism and propaganda present. In a flurry of politics, religion and morality, Bioshock Infinite presents a heartwarming and equally mind-blowing narrative. 

This game is just beautiful. I'm not talking about the graphics, I'm talking about the story. I never would have believed an FPS could offer something more than combat value and arcade style fun. Bioshock Infinite has transcended the limitations of first person shooters and has given the world a glimpse of how games can potentially be art. This game will remain my personal favourite for a long, long time.

Definitivamente unno de los mejores FPS que he jugado.

Como los anteriores bioshock tendremos poderes especiales aparde de nuestras armas. Hay muchos nuevos y variados poderes mas alguno de los que ya conocias.

Aunque ahora solo podrás cargar máximo dos armas al mismo tiempo contigo, no le baja diversión al juego.

Lo recomiendo mucho, incluso si no has jugado Bioshock 1 y 2, ya que es una historia completamente nueva y no necesitas de haber jugado los anteriores.

Awesome game

"Незабываемое приключение, из которого не хочется возвращаться" - так можно в двух словах описать BioShock Infinite. 
Игра просто пропитана атмосферой 20 века, в которой гармонично сочетаются обе стороны медали тогдашнего времени - с одной стороны - спокойствие и утончённость, а с другой - расизм и работа за еду. Одной из главных особенностей Bioshock Infinite является шедевральный сюжет, где каждая незначительная деталь может оказаться очень важной и стать дополнительным поворотом сюжета, из которых и складывается эта завораживающая история. Так чего уж тут говорить, сам сюжет я рассказывать не буду - лучше купите эту игру! Но, пожалуй, самым главным  подарком геймерам от Irrational Games является Элизабет. Она - та самая девушка, которую и надо вызволить из башни главному герою игры, Букеру ДеВитту. К большому счастью, в этой игре нас не пытаются подкупить самоходными сиськами, поэтому Элизабет из себя хрупкую молодую девушку, которая также является чертовски обаятельной и няшной. И даже не верится, что она не существует на самом деле, поскольку
по сравнению с теми людьми, с которыми вы ездите в общественном транспорте, именно те самые люди и являются каменными статуями с покер-фейсами на лицах. Вот такая она яркая и жизнерадостная!
Также вместо плазмидов в игре появились энергетики, сходные по своим действиям из прошлых игр, но в отличие от Ягуара, весьма помогающие как в бою, так и в мирное время. Итак, давайте перечислим все плюсы и минусы BioShock Infinite:

Плюсы:
+ Сюжет
+ Атмосфера
+ Геймплей
+ Элизабет, естественно
И множество прочих незначительных деталей

Минусы:
А Вам не стыдно сюда смотреть?

Вердикт: О Боже мой, это было великолепно!
Оценка: 10 из 10.

Beautiufull story grafics and dialog great game all in all :)

Bioshock Infinite takes on a whole new setting from the original 2 games. For those all too familiar with Rapture, it may be hard to digest at first, but after the first 30 minutes to an hour you begin to feel more at home in the world of Columbia.

While I have to admit I'm not big fan of fighting "law enforcement" as oppose to impaling splicers on walls, they've certainly done very well in terms of the in-game mechanics. I don't know if it was just me, but the soldiers sure seem very durable. Not sure if the weapons may just be weaker or if there's an emphasis on combos with vigors, but overall it is more challenging than the original two Bioshocks. I should emphasise that you can't really employ much of a stealthy approach in the game as you may have in the first two (if that's your style).

The visuals are simply stunning, pretty much the same as the cutscenes. The music is nice and it manages to employ a similar kind of atmosphere that's present in the originals. As a whole I think it was a great addition to a very successful series and a must buy by me!
